items.name: Space Pistol
items.description: Standard issue sidearm for security personnel. Reliable but not particularly powerful.
items.lore: Manufactured by Martian Arms Corporation, this model became popular during the Martian War due to its reliability in vacuum and low-maintenance requirements.

items.name: Mining Laser
items.description: A cutting tool repurposed as a weapon. High damage but limited range and slow firing rate.
items.lore: Originally designed for asteroid mining operations, these tools have found a second life as makeshift weapons in the Belt, where proper firearms can be hard to come by.

items.name: Light Armor Vest
items.description: Basic protection that doesn't restrict movement. Made from a composite of lightweight materials.
items.lore: These vests became standard equipment for civilians working in contested areas during the Martian War. Not military-grade, but better than nothing.

items.name: Medkit
items.description: Emergency medical supplies that can quickly heal wounds and stabilize injuries.
items.lore: Developed by Luna Medical Systems, these compact kits contain advanced nanobots and synthetic clotting agents that can treat a variety of injuries on the spot.

items.name: Energy Pack
items.description: A compact battery pack that can recharge energy weapons or power emergency systems.
items.lore: These standardized power cells were developed early in Belt exploration to ensure compatibility across different manufacturers and systems.

items.name: Neutral Diplomat Badge
items.description: A badge identifying the wearer as a neutral diplomat under Psyche's protection. Grants certain immunities in faction conflicts.
items.lore: After establishing Psyche as neutral territory, Stella Vega created this system of diplomatic recognition to allow for safer negotiation between factions.

items.name: Executive Access Card
items.description: Grants access to executive areas of Psyche Station, including secure areas and private quarters.
items.lore: Stella Vega rarely grants these high-level access cards to anyone outside her inner circle. Possessing one marks you as someone she trusts implicitly.

items.name: Advanced Ship Component
items.description: A sophisticated component from Stella's shipyard. Could be used to upgrade a spacecraft's performance.
items.lore: Components of this quality are rarely seen outside military vessels. It represents Stella's shipyard's advanced technological capabilities.

items.name: Stella Vega's Recommendation
items.description: A formal letter of recommendation from Governor Stella Vega. Can open many doors throughout the Belt.
items.lore: Despite her controversial status, Stella's word carries significant weight in business and political circles throughout the system.

items.name: Robot Override Module
items.description: A specialized device that can temporarily override and control certain types of robots, particularly military models.
items.lore: Developed during the Pallas uprising, these modules were key to turning the prison's robot guards against their Earth handlers.

items.name: Volger Authorization
items.description: A digital authorization from Volger, the Pallas revolutionary leader. Grants certain privileges in Pallas-controlled territory.
items.lore: Volger rarely extends such trust to outsiders. Those who carry his authorization are treated with respect - and caution - by Pallas operatives.

items.name: Basic Mining Tool
items.description: A standard tool used for extracting ore from asteroids. Can also serve as a makeshift weapon in emergencies.
items.lore: The backbone of Belt mining operations, these tools are designed to be durable, easy to repair, and functional in vacuum conditions.

items.name: Township Ration Pack
items.description: A week's worth of preserved food from Psyche Township's communal stores. Not particularly tasty, but nutritious.
items.lore: As Psyche Township grows, it's beginning to develop its own food production systems, reducing dependency on imports from Mars.

items.name: Encryption Device
items.description: A specialized device that encrypts and secures communications, preventing unauthorized interception.
items.lore: These devices became essential tools for journalists and activists during the Martian War, when information control was a key strategy for both sides.

items.name: Press Pass
items.description: Identifies the bearer as a journalist or media representative, potentially granting access to restricted events or areas.
items.lore: Despite the chaotic political landscape of the Belt, most factions still maintain some respect for press freedom - if only to avoid negative coverage.

items.name: Rusty Rocket Tab Card
items.description: A special card allowing the holder to order drinks and services at The Rusty Rocket free of charge.
items.lore: Ruby rarely issues these cards, reserving them for those who have proven themselves true friends of The Rusty Rocket.

items.name: Ceres Contact List
items.description: A digital list of useful contacts throughout Ceres, including merchants, fixers, and information brokers.
items.lore: In the Belt, who you know can be more valuable than what you own. This network of contacts represents years of relationship building.

items.name: Domestic Robot
items.description: A friendly household robot designed to perform chores and basic tasks. Features a cartoonish appearance to prevent attachment.
items.lore: Leo's stock includes these popular models, which have become increasingly common in Belt households as prosperity grows.

items.name: Porter Robot
items.description: A heavy-duty robot designed for cargo handling and transport. Can carry substantial loads over long distances.
items.lore: Essential to Belt commerce, these robots handle much of the manual labor in ports and warehouses, especially in zero-g environments.

items.name: Repair Kit
items.description: A comprehensive set of tools for repairing mechanical and electronic devices.
items.lore: In the resource-constrained environment of the Belt, the ability to repair rather than replace equipment is highly valued.

items.name: Psyche Ore Sample
items.description: A sample of the rare metal-rich ore from Asteroid Psyche. Valuable to collectors and researchers.
items.lore: Psyche's unique composition of metal and minerals makes it one of the most valuable asteroids in the Belt, explaining why so many factions are interested in controlling it.

items.name: Martian Whiskey
items.description: A bottle of premium whiskey distilled on Mars. Has a distinctive smoky flavor from the Martian grain.
items.lore: As Mars developed its agricultural sector, luxury goods like spirits became a point of cultural pride and a valuable export.

items.name: Martian Ale
items.description: A bottle of ale brewed from Martian-grown hops and barley. Slightly stronger than Earth varieties.
items.lore: Brewing became a popular industry during Mars's early colonization, as settlers sought comforts of home and ways to use their agricultural products.

items.name: Standard Room Rental
items.description: A ticket for one night's stay in a standard room at The Rusty Rocket.
items.lore: The Rusty Rocket's accommodations are known for being clean and secure, if not luxurious - a rare combination in Belt establishments.
